speaker: Speaker 1
text: But we are good friends. Every weekend we play tennis together.

speaker: Speaker 2
text: I play tennis. I'm jealous. Do you play tennis too? Do you want to play with us?

speaker: Speaker 1
text: Do you play tennis too? Do you want to play with us?

speaker: Speaker 2
text: Well, just joking. I don't play tennis that well. Only karate.

speaker: Speaker 3
text: I am beautiful. Don't say I beautiful. I am beautiful. I am in short form, you can say, on or you can say I'm, okay? So I am, I'm. So you can say I'm beautiful. I'm beautiful. Number two, I'm busy. Or you can say, I am busy. Remember, in writing, we cannot use short form like this. Okay? We have to use I am beautiful. When you, when it comes to speaking, you can say, I am beautiful or, I'm beautiful. In speaking, people just want to say quickly, so they usually use short form. I'm. So, I'm beautiful. I'm busy for speaking, but for writing, we use I am beautiful and I am busy. Okay? So remember, I with am. Now, number three. He is crazy. He is crazy. He is, we can say he's. So, you can say he's crazy. He's crazy. He's crazy. Now, number four. You can say in short form, he's handsome. He's handsome. Or he is handsome. Remember, in writing, we have to write, he is crazy. He is handsome. Number seven and number eight. It is sunny. So, as you can see, it go with is. Okay? It is sunny. In short form, we can say, It is it's. So you can say, it's sunny. It's sunny. Number eight, it's great. It's great. You are happy. You are attractive. For writing, for speaking, your. You're happy. You're attractive. Number 13 and number 14. We are sad. So, we go with R too. We are sad. Sad that means unhappy. We are sad. Now, we are in short form, we can say, we're. We're. Number 15 and number 16. They are excited. So, you can see they goes with R. They are. They are excited. Excited just like happy. Uh, they are. They are excited. They are, in short form, you can write, sorry, you can say, there. There. Just like over there. There. So, I can say, they're excited. Right? Number 16. They're hungry. They're hungry. Or I can say, they are hungry. So, in writing, we should write, they are excited. They are hungry. So, remember, not is usually after B and before adjective. Okay? And I, I goes with M. She, he, it, singular noun, we use is. And not is not. Okay? Or isn't. Or for she, he, it, we can use not. For you, we, they, for you, we, they, and the plural nouns, we can use are. And if not, we use are not or aren't. And for you, we, they, you can use the short form like this. Your. You're not. We're not. Or they're not. Am I young? Am I young? Do you think that I'm young? Am I young? Okay. I'm fun. Am I fun? Okay. Am I fun? Or am I interesting? Um, okay. You have to pay attention to my intonation. Okay, here. I am young. Okay. So, the question, Am I young? Am I young? So you raise your voice. Okay? At the end of the question, for yes no question. I am, Am I young? Okay. Am I fun? So, how do you answer? If I ask you, am I young? Am I fun? How do you answer me? If you think so, you would say, yes, you are because I ask you, like, am I young? Am I fun? And you have to answer me, yes, you are. You that means me. Okay? Yes, you are. Or you don't think so, you say, no, you aren't. Okay? Aren't, also say aren't, aren't. Yes, you are. No, you aren't. You are unhappy. When I move into the question, Are you unhappy? Are you unhappy? Remember to raise your voice at the end of the question. Are you unhappy? Are you unhappy? You're sleepy. Are you sleepy? Are you sleepy? Okay. Sleepy that means you want to go to sleep. So, if I ask you, are you unhappy? Are you sleepy? If it is correct, you have to answer, yes, I am. Yes, I am. Or you can link them together. Yes, I, Yes, I am. Or, no, I'm not. No, I'm not. So, hope, rope, telescope, envelope, cope, grope, slope, microscope, lope, elope. Okay. Now, I hope to meet him soon. Hope. Do you like to skip rope? Rope. My father wants to buy a telescope. We have telescope. Could you read the address on the envelope for me? Envelope. We believe that he will be able to cope with the problems. Cope. She was groping her way up to the staircase in the dark. Groping, grope. Can you see that the sun is sloping in the west? Slope. May I borrow your microscope? Microscope. Our dogs were loping along beside my mom. Lope. My cousin has eloped with her boyfriend.
